main event: A luminous long white streak was observed going from horizon to horizon in Muncie, Indiana on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The sighting was recorded by the U.S. Air Force Project Blue Book., The object was categorized as probably being a meteor based on its flight path., The sighting lasted for an unknown duration., The observation was made using ground radar, air visual, and air-intercept radar., The report involved a questionnaire filled out by the observer regarding details of the sighting.
sighted object: one luminous long white streak in the sky
witness description: The witness was flying over Muncie, Indiana, observing the object.
